content.text: is designed to process billing information for accounts that have billing periods spanning multiple months. It parses and distributes the billing amounts and charges over the spanned periods, adjusting the data to fit into a monthly billing cycle. The procedure reads from a table containing spanned billing records, calculates the distribution of charges across the periods, and inserts the parsed data into a temporary table for further processing or reporting.
This procedure is complex due to several factors:
It involves numerous variables and calculations to distribute billing amounts across multiple periods.
It uses a cursor to iterate over records, which can be resource-intensive.
It involves multiple nested operations and calculations, including calls to user-defined functions.
The procedure handles a wide range of financial data, requiring careful management of rounding and precision.
format. It is used to identify the period for which the billing data is being processed.
: Represents the ID of the authenticated user executing the procedure. It is used for logging and tracking purposes.
: The procedure begins by declaring a large number of variables to hold intermediate and final values for various billing components.
is declared and opened to iterate over records in the
table where the number of billing periods is greater than one.
For each record fetched by the cursor, the procedure initializes counters and sums for the billing components.
It calculates the total percentage of gas billed over the spanned periods using a user-defined function.
It enters a loop to distribute the billing amounts across the periods, calculating the monthly percentage for each period and applying it to the various charges.
The procedure inserts the parsed data into the
: After processing all but the last period, the procedure calculates the remaining amounts to account for rounding errors and inserts the final period's data.
: The cursor is closed and deallocated after processing all records.
: The procedure prints the number of spanned rows processed and the number of parsed transactions.
: The use of a cursor can lead to performance bottlenecks, especially if the dataset is large. Cursors are generally slower than set-based operations.
: The procedure performs numerous calculations and calls to user-defined functions, which can increase execution time.
: The extensive use of variables and calculations may lead to high memory and CPU usage.
: The procedure involves multiple rounding operations, which could lead to discrepancies if not handled carefully.
: If multiple instances of this procedure run simultaneously, it could lead to contention on the tables being read and written.
: The procedure lacks explicit error handling, which could lead to unhandled exceptions and incomplete processing.
: As the volume of data grows, the performance of the cursor-based approach may degrade significantly.
: The procedure assumes that the data in the source table is accurate and complete. Any anomalies in the data could lead to incorrect calculations and results.

-- =============================================
-- Author:		<Author,,Name>
-- Create date: <Create Date,,>
-- Description:	<Description,,>
-- =============================================
CREATE PROCEDURE [CrisNationalGridWest].[usp_CRIS_PreProcessParsingSpannedAccountInfoCancellation] 
	@BillingPeriod varchar(6),
	@authenticatedID int
AS
BEGIN
	/*
2. Parse Spanned Billed uploaded
*/

--************************************************************************************** 
--Declare Variables                                            
--**************************************************************************************
--
declare @UploadCrisAccountBillingCancellationSeqid dbo.seqid
--declare @AccountNumber dbo.acctnum
declare @Notes dbo.notes
--declare @PostingDate varchar(8)
--
--
--declare @CalculatedBillingPeriodRevision varchar(6)
declare @GasChargeSummedPieces money

declare @MeterReadWorkDay varchar(2)
declare @FirstBillingPeriodCanceled varchar(6)
declare @NumberOfBillingPeriod int
declare @GasChargeAmount money
declare @BillingFromDate varchar(8)
declare @BillingToDate varchar(8)
declare @BilledCCF int
declare @BilledTherms int
declare @CommodityChargeAmount money
declare @DeliveryChargeAmount money
declare @MTACommodityTax money
declare @MTADeliveryTax money
declare @SalesTax money
declare @SystemBenefitsCharge money
declare @RetailDecouplingMechanismCharge money
declare @DeliveryRateSurcharge money
declare @RealTimeNormalizationCharge money
declare @LatePaymentCharge money
declare @PaperBillCharge money
declare @PaperDefaultBillCharge money
--
declare @NumberOfPeriodsMinusOne dbo.Accumulator
declare @NumberOfSpannedRows dbo.Accumulator

--declare @FirstPeriodCanceled dbo.yyyymm 
declare @ThermFactor dbo.ThermsFactor 
--declare @FudgedThermFactor dbo.ThermsFactor 
declare @BillingPeriodRevision dbo.yyyymm 
--declare @FromDate dbo.yyyymmdd 
--declare @ToDate dbo.yyyymmdd 
declare @CalculatedBillingPeriodRevision dbo.yyyymm 
declare @CalculatedFromDate dbo.yyyymmdd 
declare @CalculatedToDate dbo.yyyymmdd 
--declare @BilledAmount dbo.BillingAmt 
declare @BilledAmountMonthly dbo.BillingAmt 
declare @BilledAmountMonthlySum dbo.BillingAmt 
--declare @BilledAmountAverage dbo.BillingAmt 
--declare @BilledAmountRemainder dbo.BillingAmt 
--declare @BillingPeriodDays dbo.Accumulator 
--declare @BillingPeriodDaysAverage dbo.Accumulator 
--declare @BillingPeriodDaysRemainder dbo.Accumulator 
--declare @Therms dbo.EnergyUnit 
--declare @LastPeriodTherms dbo.EnergyUnit 
--declare @ThermsAverage dbo.EnergyUnit 
--declare @ThermsRemainder dbo.EnergyUnit 
--declare @CCF dbo.EnergyUnit 
--declare @CCFAverage dbo.EnergyUnit 
--declare @CCFRemainder dbo.EnergyUnit 
--declare @SumAverageCCF dbo.EnergyUnit 
declare @idx int
--declare @StartingBillingPeriodDaysIncrement int
--declare @StartingBillingPeriodCCFIncrement int
--declare @StartingBillingPeriodThermsIncrement int
--declare @IncrementBillingPeriodDays int
--declare @IncrementBillingPeriodCCF int
--declare @IncrementBillingPeriodTherms int
-- 
declare @BilledAmountMonthlyLastPeriod dbo.BillingAmt
declare @ThermsMonthlyLastPeriod dbo.EnergyUnit 
declare @CCFMonthlyLastPeriod dbo.EnergyUnit 

--declare @UtilityCode dbo.seqid
declare @ApplyMonthlyPercentage  dbo.DiscountPercentage
declare @ThermsMonthlySum  dbo.EnergyUnit 
declare @ThermsMonthly  dbo.EnergyUnit 
declare @CCFMonthly  dbo.EnergyUnit 
declare @CCFMonthlySum  dbo.EnergyUnit 
declare @TotalGasSpannedBilledPercentage dbo.DiscountPercentage
--
declare @SystemBenefitsChargeMonthly money 
declare @SystemBenefitsChargeMonthlySum money 
declare @SalesTaxMonthlySum money 
declare @RetailDecouplingMechanismChargeMonthly money 
declare @SalesTaxMonthly money 
declare @RetailDecouplingMechanismChargeMonthlySum money 
declare @MTADeliveryTaxMonthlySum money 
declare @DeliveryRateSurchargeMonthly money 
declare @MTADeliveryTaxMonthly money 
declare @DeliveryRateSurchargeMonthlySum money 
declare @MTACommodityTaxMonthlySum money 
declare @RealTimeNormalizationChargeMonthly money 
declare @MTACommodityTaxMonthly money 
declare @RealTimeNormalizationChargeMonthlySum money 
declare @DeliveryChargeAmountMonthlySum money 
declare @LatePaymentChargeMonthly money 
declare @DeliveryChargeAmountMonthly money 
declare @LatePaymentChargeMonthlySum money 
declare @CommodityChargeAmountMonthlySum money 
declare @PaperBillChargeMonthly money 
declare @CommodityChargeAmountMonthly money 
declare @PaperBillChargeMonthlySum money 
--
declare @PaperBillChargeMonthlyLastPeriod money
declare @LatePaymentChargeMonthlyLastPeriod money
declare @RealTimeNormalizationChargeMonthlyLastPeriod money
declare @DeliveryRateSurchargeMonthlyLastPeriod money
declare @RetailDecouplingMechanismChargeMonthlyLastPeriod money
declare @SystemBenefitsChargeMonthlyLastPeriod money
declare @SalesTaxMonthlyLastPeriod money
declare @MTADeliveryTaxMonthlyLastPeriod money
declare @MTACommodityTaxMonthlyLastPeriod money
--declare @MTACommodityTaxMonthlyLastPeriodmoney money
declare @DeliveryChargeAmountMonthlyLastPeriod money
declare @CommodityChargeAmountMonthlyLastPeriod money
--declare @SystemBenefitsChargeLastPeriod money 
--declare @SalesTaxLastPeriod money 
--declare @RetailDecouplingMechanismChargeLastPeriod money 
--declare @MTADeliveryTaxLastPeriod money 
--declare @DeliveryRateSurchargeLastPeriod money 
--declare @MTACommodityTaxLastPeriod money 
--declare @RealTimeNormalizationChargeLastPeriod money 
--declare @DeliveryChargeAmountLastPeriod money 
--declare @LatePaymentChargeLastPeriod money 
--declare @CommodityChargeAmountLastPeriod money 
--declare @PaperBillChargeLastPeriod money 
--
declare @NumberOfParsedSpannedTranscations int

--**************************************************************************************  
--SET DEFAULTS                                                  
--**************************************************************************************
set @PaperDefaultBillCharge = .78
set @NumberOfParsedSpannedTranscations = 0
set @NumberOfSpannedRows = 0
--**************************************************************************************  
--Main Process                                      
--**************************************************************************************

--	DECLARE a cursor to find all account bills that span more than one period.
--truncate table CrisNationalGridWest.UploadAccountBillingAdjustmentCrisGas
--
DECLARE SpannedGasBillCursor CURSOR FOR
SELECT  UploadCrisAccountBillingCancellationSeqid, NumberOfBillingPeriod,BillingPeriodRevision
FROM CrisNationalGridWest.[UploadCrisAccountBillingCancellation]
WHERE (NumberOfBillingPeriod > 1)

OPEN SpannedGasBillCursor; -- open curser

FETCH NEXT FROM SpannedGasBillCursor INTO @UploadCrisAccountBillingCancellationSeqid,@NumberOfBillingPeriod,@BillingPeriodRevision
--
-- Check @@FETCH_STATUS to see if there are any more rows to fetch.
--
WHILE @@FETCH_STATUS = 0
BEGIN -- begin processing for fetched record
	--
	set @NumberOfParsedSpannedTranscations =@NumberOfParsedSpannedTranscations + @NumberOfBillingPeriod
	set @NumberOfSpannedRows =@NumberOfSpannedRows + 1
	
	/*
		1. set value for variables for parsing purposes
	*/	
	SELECT  @BillingPeriod=BillingPeriod,
			@MeterReadWorkDay = MeterReadWorkDay,
			@CalculatedBillingPeriodRevision=CalculatedBillingPeriodRevision, 
			@FirstBillingPeriodCanceled=FirstBillingPeriodCanceled, 
			@NumberOfBillingPeriod=NumberOfBillingPeriod,
			@GasChargeAmount=GasChargeAmount,
			@BillingFromDate=FromDate,
			@BillingToDate=ToDate, 
			@BilledCCF=BilledCCF, 
			@BilledTherms=BilledTherms,
			@CommodityChargeAmount=CommodityChargeAmount,
			@DeliveryChargeAmount=DeliveryChargeAmount,
			@MTACommodityTax=MTACommodityTax, 
			@MTADeliveryTax=MTADeliveryTax,
			@SalesTax=SalesTax,
			@SystemBenefitsCharge=SystemBenefitsCharge, 
			@RetailDecouplingMechanismCharge=RetailDecouplingMechanismCharge,
			@DeliveryRateSurcharge=DeliveryRateSurcharge, 
			@RealTimeNormalizationCharge=RealTimeNormalizationCharge,
			@LatePaymentCharge=LatePaymentCharge, 
			@PaperBillCharge=PaperBillCharge,
			@ThermFactor = ThermFactor

	FROM 
			CrisNationalGridWest.[UploadCrisAccountBillingCancellation]
	WHERE   
			(UploadCrisAccountBillingCancellationSeqid = @UploadCrisAccountBillingCancellationSeqid) 

	/*
		2. Distribute over spanned based on given percentage
	*/

	-- 2.1 period Aggregate the average City wide monthly gas usage percentage for the spanned row billing periods 
	select @TotalGasSpannedBilledPercentage= dbo.[CalculateTotalGasSpannedBilledPercentage] ('M',@NumberOfBillingPeriod,@FirstBillingPeriodCanceled,@CalculatedBillingPeriodRevision)
		
	-- 2.2 Determine the number of periods minus 1 to pro-rate the money and usage.  The last period will derive the money and usage
	--	by row totals - (the n-1 aggregates of money and usage)
	--set @NumberOfPeriodsMinusOne = @NumberOfBillingPeriod - 1


	--
	--	2.3 Initialize the counters for the n-1 parses
	--
	set @CalculatedBillingPeriodRevision = @FirstBillingPeriodCanceled
	set @CalculatedFromDate = @BillingFromDate
	set @CalculatedToDate = @BillingToDate
	set @idx = 1
	set @BilledAmountMonthlySum = 0.00
	set @ThermsMonthlySum = 0
	set @CCFMonthlySum = 0
	--
	set @CommodityChargeAmountMonthlySum = 0
	set @DeliveryChargeAmountMonthlySum = 0
	set @MTACommodityTaxMonthlySum = 0
	set @MTADeliveryTaxMonthlySum = 0
	set @SalesTaxMonthlySum = 0
	set @SystemBenefitsChargeMonthlySum = 0
	set @RetailDecouplingMechanismChargeMonthlySum = 0
	set @DeliveryRateSurchargeMonthlySum = 0
	set @RealTimeNormalizationChargeMonthlySum = 0
	set @LatePaymentChargeMonthlySum = 0
	set @PaperBillChargeMonthlySum = 0	
	--
	set @CommodityChargeAmountMonthlyLastPeriod = 0
	set @DeliveryChargeAmountMonthlyLastPeriod = 0
	set @MTACommodityTaxMonthlyLastPeriod = 0
	set @MTADeliveryTaxMonthlyLastPeriod = 0
	set @SalesTaxMonthlyLastPeriod = 0
	set @SystemBenefitsChargeMonthlyLastPeriod = 0
	set @RetailDecouplingMechanismChargeMonthlyLastPeriod = 0
	set @DeliveryRateSurchargeMonthlyLastPeriod = 0
	set @RealTimeNormalizationChargeMonthlyLastPeriod = 0
	set @LatePaymentChargeMonthlyLastPeriod = 0
	set @PaperBillChargeMonthlyLastPeriod = 0	
	--
	
	--- 2.4 distribute / parse
	while (@NumberOfBillingPeriod > @idx)
	Begin 

		-- 2.4.1 set value for required variables

		-- The @ApplyMonthlyPercentage holds the weigthed average for the particular month
		select @ApplyMonthlyPercentage = [dbo].[CalculateApplyMonthlyPercentageGasSpannedBilled] (@CalculatedBillingPeriodRevision,@TotalGasSpannedBilledPercentage)

		--
		-- Apply the Monthly Percentage to the CCF,Therms and Billed Amount and accumulate the weigthed average units.
		--
		set @BilledAmountMonthly = ROUND(@GasChargeAmount * @ApplyMonthlyPercentage,2)
		set @BilledAmountMonthlySum = @BilledAmountMonthlySum + @BilledAmountMonthly
		--
		set @DeliveryChargeAmountMonthly = ROUND(@DeliveryChargeAmount * @ApplyMonthlyPercentage,2)
		set @DeliveryChargeAmountMonthlySum =@DeliveryChargeAmountMonthlySum + @DeliveryChargeAmountMonthly
		set @MTACommodityTaxMonthly = ROUND(@MTACommodityTax * @ApplyMonthlyPercentage,2)
		set @MTACommodityTaxMonthlySum =@MTACommodityTaxMonthlySum + @MTACommodityTaxMonthly
		set @MTADeliveryTaxMonthly = ROUND(@MTADeliveryTax * @ApplyMonthlyPercentage,2)
		set @MTADeliveryTaxMonthlySum =@MTADeliveryTaxMonthlySum + @MTADeliveryTaxMonthly
		set @SalesTaxMonthly = ROUND(@SalesTax * @ApplyMonthlyPercentage,2)
		set @SalesTaxMonthlySum =@SalesTaxMonthlySum + @SalesTaxMonthly
		set @SystemBenefitsChargeMonthly = ROUND(@SystemBenefitsCharge * @ApplyMonthlyPercentage,2)
		set @SystemBenefitsChargeMonthlySum =@SystemBenefitsChargeMonthlySum + @SystemBenefitsChargeMonthly
		set @RetailDecouplingMechanismChargeMonthly = ROUND(@RetailDecouplingMechanismCharge * @ApplyMonthlyPercentage,2)
		set @RetailDecouplingMechanismChargeMonthlySum =@RetailDecouplingMechanismChargeMonthlySum + @RetailDecouplingMechanismChargeMonthly
		set @DeliveryRateSurchargeMonthly = ROUND(@DeliveryRateSurcharge * @ApplyMonthlyPercentage,2)
		set @DeliveryRateSurchargeMonthlySum =@DeliveryRateSurchargeMonthlySum + @DeliveryRateSurchargeMonthly
		set @RealTimeNormalizationChargeMonthly = ROUND(@RealTimeNormalizationCharge * @ApplyMonthlyPercentage,2)
		set @RealTimeNormalizationChargeMonthlySum =@RealTimeNormalizationChargeMonthlySum + @RealTimeNormalizationChargeMonthly
		set @LatePaymentChargeMonthly = ROUND(@LatePaymentCharge * @ApplyMonthlyPercentage,2)
		set @LatePaymentChargeMonthlySum =@LatePaymentChargeMonthlySum + @LatePaymentChargeMonthly
		set @PaperBillChargeMonthly = @PaperDefaultBillCharge -- ROUND(@PaperBillCharge * @ApplyMonthlyPercentage,2)
		set @PaperBillChargeMonthlySum =@PaperBillChargeMonthlySum + @PaperBillChargeMonthly
		--
		--	Derive the @CommodityChargeAmountMonthly by 
		set @CommodityChargeAmountMonthly	 =	@BilledAmountMonthly - round((@DeliveryChargeAmountMonthlySum + @MTACommodityTaxMonthlySum + @MTADeliveryTaxMonthlySum + @SalesTaxMonthlySum + @SystemBenefitsChargeMonthlySum +
												@RetailDecouplingMechanismChargeMonthlySum + @DeliveryRateSurchargeMonthlySum + @RealTimeNormalizationChargeMonthlySum + @LatePaymentChargeMonthlySum +
												@PaperBillChargeMonthlySum),2)		
		set @CommodityChargeAmountMonthlySum =	@CommodityChargeAmountMonthlySum + @CommodityChargeAmountMonthly
		--
		--	Check @GasChargeSummedPieces by aggregating the pieces
		set @GasChargeSummedPieces	 =	@CommodityChargeAmountMonthly + round((@DeliveryChargeAmountMonthlySum + @MTACommodityTaxMonthlySum + @MTADeliveryTaxMonthlySum + @SalesTaxMonthlySum + @SystemBenefitsChargeMonthlySum +
												@RetailDecouplingMechanismChargeMonthlySum + @DeliveryRateSurchargeMonthlySum + @RealTimeNormalizationChargeMonthlySum + @LatePaymentChargeMonthlySum +
												@PaperBillChargeMonthlySum),2)		
				
		--
		set @ThermsMonthly = ROUND(@BilledTherms * @ApplyMonthlyPercentage,0)
		set @ThermsMonthlySum = @ThermsMonthlySum + @ThermsMonthly
		set @CCFMonthly = ROUND(@BilledCCF * @ApplyMonthlyPercentage,0)
		set @CCFMonthlySum = @CCFMonthlySum + @CCFMonthly
		--
		--	The Billing Period Projected "ToDate" is derived from the table "dbo.BillingPeriodProjected" using the utility company seqid and the
		--	RevisedBillingPeriod and using the "EndofPeriodTodate" as the derived "Todate" for the account.
		--
		select @CalculatedToDate=CrisNationalGridWest.DetermineToDateFromBillingPeriodAndWDNumber(@MeterReadWorkDay,@CalculatedBillingPeriodRevision)

		-- 2.4.2	Create a custom note that explains how the information was parsed and what was the original information of the spanned row.
		--	It will note in EC3 that the transaction was derived.
		select @Notes = SUBSTRING('Therm factor '+cast(@ThermFactor as varchar(6))+
		' for '+cast(@NumberOfBillingPeriod as varchar(6))+' periods  First: '+@FirstBillingPeriodCanceled +' ( '+@BillingFromDate+') Last: '+ 
		@BillingPeriodRevision +' ( '+@BillingToDate+'). '+' period: '+@CalculatedBillingPeriodRevision+ ' Month %: '+cast(@ApplyMonthlyPercentage as varchar(10))+
		' - Total %: '+cast(@TotalGasSpannedBilledPercentage as varchar(10)), 1, 300)

	--
	--	2.4.3  INSERT the data into the table "CrisNationalGridWest.UploadAccountBillingAdjustmentCrisGas"
	--
		INSERT INTO CrisNationalGridWest.UploadAccountBillingAdjustmentCrisGasTempCancellation
					(UtilityCompanySeqid, AccountInvoiceBillingGroup, BillingPeriod, BillingPeriodRevision, FirstBillingPeriodCanceled, IsSpannedBilling, 
					NumberOfBillingPeriod, IsCurrentPeriodExchange, AccountNumber, MeterReadWorkDay, AccountBillingStatus, PreviousAccountBillingStatus, 
					AccountBillingStatusCodePeriod, UtilityServiceAccountName, UtilityServiceAddress, Borough, Zipcode, State, ActivityCode, ActivityDateTime, 
					SpecialLedgerAccountNUmber, GasRateCode, BillFrequency, EstimatedOrActualBillingCode, GasChargeAmount, FromDate, ToDate, BillRenderDate, 
					BillingDays, BilledCCF, ThermFactor, BilledTherms, NumberOfMeters, BillType, CommodityChargeAmount, DeliveryChargeAmount, MTACommodityTax,
					MTADeliveryTax, SalesTax, SystemBenefitsCharge, RetailDecouplingMechanismCharge, DeliveryRateSurcharge, RealTimeNormalizationCharge, 
					LatePaymentCharge, PaperBillCharge, CommodityCostFactor, MTACommodityFactor, MTADeliveryFactor, SalesTaxFactor, SystemBenefitChargeFactor, 
					RetailDecouplingMechanismFactor, DeliveryRateSurchargeFactor, RealTimeNormalizationFactor, LatePaymentFactor, PriorPeriodAccountBalance, 
					AccountArrears, TerminationBalance, TotalPaymentsPosted, CurrentAccountBalance, DateLastPayment, MiscellaneousChargeAmount, 
					MiscellaneousChargeType, SpannedGasChargeAmount, SpannedBilledCCF, SpannedBilledTherms, SpannedBillingPeriodRevision,SpannedFirstBillingPeriodCanceled,SpannedFromDate,SpannedToDate,
					LastUpdate, Notes, AuthenticatedUserID, 
					DateAdded,TransactionCode,FirstNewCRISBillingPeriodRevision,GasChargeSummedPieces)
		SELECT    
						UtilityCompanySeqid,
						AccountInvoiceBillingGroup,
						@BillingPeriod, --BillingPeriod,
						@CalculatedBillingPeriodRevision, --BillingPeriodRevision,
						FirstBillingPeriodCanceled,
						IsSpannedBilling,
						1, -- Always change NumberOfBillingPeriod to 1
						IsCurrentPeriodExchange,
						AccountNumber,
						MeterReadWorkDay,
						'AC', --AccountBillingStatus,
						'46', --PreviousAccountBillingStatus,
						@BillingPeriod, --AccountBillingStatusCodePeriod,
						UtilityServiceAccountName,
						UtilityServiceAddress,
						Borough,
						Zipcode,
						State,
						ActivityCode,
						ActivityDateTime,
						SpecialLedgerAccountNUmber,
						GasRateCode,
						BillFrequency,
						EstimatedOrActualBillingCode,
						@BilledAmountMonthly, --GasChargeAmount,
						@CalculatedFromDate, --FromDate,
						@CalculatedToDate, --ToDate,
						BillRenderDate,
						dbo.CalculateNumberOfBillingDays(@CalculatedFromDate,@CalculatedToDate), --BillingDays,
						@CCFMonthly, --BilledCCF,
						ThermFactor,
						@ThermsMonthly, --BilledTherms,
						NumberOfMeters,
						BillType,
						@CommodityChargeAmountMonthly, --CommodityChargeAmount,
						@DeliveryChargeAmountMonthly, --DeliveryChargeAmount,
						@MTACommodityTaxMonthly, --MTACommodityTax,
						@MTADeliveryTaxMonthly, --MTADeliveryTax,
						@SalesTaxMonthly, --SalesTax,
						@SystemBenefitsChargeMonthly, -- SystemBenefitsCharge,
						@RetailDecouplingMechanismChargeMonthly, --RetailDecouplingMechanismCharge,
						@DeliveryRateSurchargeMonthly, --DeliveryRateSurcharge,
						@RealTimeNormalizationChargeMonthly, -- RealTimeNormalizationCharge,
						@LatePaymentChargeMonthly, --LatePaymentCharge,
						@PaperBillChargeMonthly, --PaperBillCharge,
						CommodityCostFactor,
						MTACommodityFactor,
						MTADeliveryFactor,
						SalesTaxFactor,SystemBenefitChargeFactor,
						RetailDecouplingMechanismFactor,
						DeliveryRateSurchargeFactor,
						RealTimeNormalizationFactor,
						LatePaymentFactor,
						PriorPeriodAccountBalance,
						0, -- AcountArrears will be applied to the current period
						0, -- TerminationBalance will be applied to the current period
						0, -- TotalPaymentsPosted,
						0, -- CurrentAccountBalance,
						null, --DateLastPayment,
						0, -- MiscellaneousChargeAmount,
						0, -- MiscellaneousChargeType,
						@GasChargeAmount, --SpannedGasChargeAmount,
						@BilledCCF, --SpannedBilledCCF,
						@BilledTherms, --SpannedBilledTherms,
						@CalculatedBillingPeriodRevision, --[SpannedBillingPeriodRevision]
						@FirstBillingPeriodCanceled, --[SpannedFirstBillingPeriodCanceled]
						@BillingFromDate, --[SpannedFromDate]
						@BillingToDate, --[SpannedToDate]
						getdate(), --LastUpdate,
						@Notes, -- Notes,
						AuthenticatedUserID,
						getdate(), --DateAdded
						TransactionCode,FirstNewCRISBillingPeriodRevision,@GasChargeSummedPieces
		FROM CrisNationalGridWest.UploadCrisAccountBillingCancellation	
		WHERE   (UploadCrisAccountBillingCancellationSeqid = @UploadCrisAccountBillingCancellationSeqid) 
		--
		--print @Notes+'=========>Summed:  '+ cast(@@rowcount as varchar(10))+'>>>>>>>>>>>>>'+@CalculatedFromDate+'----'+@CalculatedToDate
			--
			--	Set up for the next the Revised Billing Period row.
			--
			--	Calculate the next the Revised Billing Period row.
			select @CalculatedBillingPeriodRevision = [dbo].[CalculateNextBillingPeriod]  (@CalculatedBillingPeriodRevision,'M')
			
			--	This will derive the new Revised Billing Period row's "FromDate"
			--select @CalculatedFromDate = CrisNationalGridWest.DetermineFromDateFromBillingPeriodAndWDNumber(@MeterReadWorkDay,@CalculatedBillingPeriodRevision)
			select @CalculatedFromDate = @CalculatedToDate -- CrisNationalGridWest.DetermineFromDateFromBillingPeriodAndWDNumber(@MeterReadWorkDay,@CalculatedBillingPeriodRevision)
			
		set @idx = @idx + 1
	end -- end distribute/parse


	--
	--	2.4.4 Finish up the last period's processing
	--
	--	Use the (Nth -1) periods @CalculatedToDate as the "FromDate" and the acutal "ToDate" from the spanned record as the "ToDate"
	--
	select @CalculatedFromDate = @CalculatedToDate
	select @CalculatedToDate = @BillingToDate
	--
	--	@ApplyMonthlyPercentage is used for the notes purposes only
	--
	select @ApplyMonthlyPercentage = [dbo].[CalculateApplyMonthlyPercentageGasSpannedBilled] (@CalculatedBillingPeriodRevision,@TotalGasSpannedBilledPercentage)
	--
	--	Derive the net changes to avoid rounding errors
	--
	set @BilledAmountMonthlyLastPeriod = @GasChargeAmount - @BilledAmountMonthlySum
	set @ThermsMonthlyLastPeriod = @BilledTherms - @ThermsMonthlySum
	set @CCFMonthlyLastPeriod = @BilledCCF  - @CCFMonthlySum
	--
	set @DeliveryChargeAmountMonthlyLastPeriod = @DeliveryChargeAmount - @DeliveryChargeAmountMonthlySum
	set @MTACommodityTaxMonthlyLastPeriod = @MTACommodityTax - @MTACommodityTaxMonthlySum
	set @MTADeliveryTaxMonthlyLastPeriod = @MTADeliveryTax - @MTADeliveryTaxMonthlySum
	set @SalesTaxMonthlyLastPeriod = @SalesTax - @SalesTaxMonthlySum
	set @SystemBenefitsChargeMonthlyLastPeriod = @SystemBenefitsCharge - @SystemBenefitsChargeMonthlySum
	set @RetailDecouplingMechanismChargeMonthlyLastPeriod = @RetailDecouplingMechanismCharge - @RetailDecouplingMechanismChargeMonthlySum
	set @DeliveryRateSurchargeMonthlyLastPeriod = @DeliveryRateSurcharge - @DeliveryRateSurchargeMonthlySum
	set @RealTimeNormalizationChargeMonthlyLastPeriod = @RealTimeNormalizationCharge - @RealTimeNormalizationChargeMonthlySum
	set @LatePaymentChargeMonthlyLastPeriod = @LatePaymentCharge - @LatePaymentChargeMonthlySum
	set @PaperBillChargeMonthlyLastPeriod = @PaperBillCharge - @PaperBillChargeMonthlySum
--
	--set @CommodityChargeAmountMonthlyLastPeriod = @CommodityChargeAmount - @CommodityChargeAmountMonthlySum
	set @CommodityChargeAmountMonthlyLastPeriod =	@BilledAmountMonthlyLastPeriod - round((@DeliveryChargeAmountMonthlyLastPeriod + @MTACommodityTaxMonthlyLastPeriod + @MTADeliveryTaxMonthlyLastPeriod + @SalesTaxMonthlyLastPeriod + @SystemBenefitsChargeMonthlyLastPeriod +
													@RetailDecouplingMechanismChargeMonthlyLastPeriod + @DeliveryRateSurchargeMonthlyLastPeriod + @RealTimeNormalizationChargeMonthlyLastPeriod + @LatePaymentChargeMonthlyLastPeriod +
													@PaperBillChargeMonthlyLastPeriod),2)		
	--
	--	Create a custom note that explains how the information was parsed and what was the original information of the spanned row.
	--	It will note in EC3 that the transaction was derived.
	--
		select @Notes = SUBSTRING('Therm factor '+cast(@ThermFactor as varchar(6))+
		' for '+cast(@NumberOfBillingPeriod as varchar(6))+' periods  First: '+@FirstBillingPeriodCanceled +' ( '+@BillingFromDate+') Last: '+ 
		@BillingPeriodRevision +' ( '+@BillingToDate+'). '+' period: '+@CalculatedBillingPeriodRevision+ ' Month %: '+cast(@ApplyMonthlyPercentage as varchar(10))+
		' - Total %: '+cast(@TotalGasSpannedBilledPercentage as varchar(10)), 1, 300)
	--PAH
	--
	--	Check @GasChargeLastPeriodmedPieces by aggregating the pieces
	set @GasChargeSummedPieces	 = round((@CommodityChargeAmountMonthlyLastPeriod + @DeliveryChargeAmountMonthlyLastPeriod + @MTACommodityTaxMonthlyLastPeriod + @MTADeliveryTaxMonthlyLastPeriod + @SalesTaxMonthlyLastPeriod + @SystemBenefitsChargeMonthlyLastPeriod +
											@RetailDecouplingMechanismChargeMonthlyLastPeriod + @DeliveryRateSurchargeMonthlyLastPeriod + @RealTimeNormalizationChargeMonthlyLastPeriod + @LatePaymentChargeMonthlyLastPeriod +
											@PaperBillChargeMonthlyLastPeriod),2)		
	--
	--
	--	INSERT the data into the table "CrisNationalGridWest.UploadAccountBillingAdjustmentCrisGas"
	--
		INSERT INTO CrisNationalGridWest.UploadAccountBillingAdjustmentCrisGasTempCancellation
					(UtilityCompanySeqid, AccountInvoiceBillingGroup, BillingPeriod, BillingPeriodRevision, FirstBillingPeriodCanceled, IsSpannedBilling, 
					NumberOfBillingPeriod, IsCurrentPeriodExchange, AccountNumber, MeterReadWorkDay, AccountBillingStatus, PreviousAccountBillingStatus, 
					AccountBillingStatusCodePeriod, UtilityServiceAccountName, UtilityServiceAddress, Borough, Zipcode, State, ActivityCode, ActivityDateTime, 
					SpecialLedgerAccountNUmber, GasRateCode, BillFrequency, EstimatedOrActualBillingCode, GasChargeAmount, FromDate, ToDate, BillRenderDate, 
					BillingDays, BilledCCF, ThermFactor, BilledTherms, NumberOfMeters, BillType, CommodityChargeAmount, DeliveryChargeAmount, MTACommodityTax,
					MTADeliveryTax, SalesTax, SystemBenefitsCharge, RetailDecouplingMechanismCharge, DeliveryRateSurcharge, RealTimeNormalizationCharge, 
					LatePaymentCharge, PaperBillCharge, CommodityCostFactor, MTACommodityFactor, MTADeliveryFactor, SalesTaxFactor, SystemBenefitChargeFactor, 
					RetailDecouplingMechanismFactor, DeliveryRateSurchargeFactor, RealTimeNormalizationFactor, LatePaymentFactor, PriorPeriodAccountBalance, 
					AccountArrears, TerminationBalance, TotalPaymentsPosted, CurrentAccountBalance, DateLastPayment, MiscellaneousChargeAmount, 
					MiscellaneousChargeType, SpannedGasChargeAmount, SpannedBilledCCF, SpannedBilledTherms, SpannedBillingPeriodRevision,SpannedFirstBillingPeriodCanceled,SpannedFromDate,SpannedToDate,
					LastUpdate, Notes, AuthenticatedUserID, 
					DateAdded,TransactionCode,FirstNewCRISBillingPeriodRevision,GasChargeSummedPieces)
		SELECT    
						UtilityCompanySeqid,
						AccountInvoiceBillingGroup,
						@BillingPeriod, --BillingPeriod,
						@CalculatedBillingPeriodRevision, --BillingPeriodRevision,
						FirstBillingPeriodCanceled,
						IsSpannedBilling,
						1, -- Always change NumberOfBillingPeriod to 1
						IsCurrentPeriodExchange,
						AccountNumber,
						MeterReadWorkDay,
						'AC', --AccountBillingStatus,
						'46', --PreviousAccountBillingStatus,
						@BillingPeriod, --AccountBillingStatusCodePeriod,
						UtilityServiceAccountName,
						UtilityServiceAddress,
						Borough,
						Zipcode,
						State,
						ActivityCode,
						ActivityDateTime,
						SpecialLedgerAccountNUmber,
						GasRateCode,
						BillFrequency,
						EstimatedOrActualBillingCode,
						@BilledAmountMonthlyLastPeriod, --GasChargeAmount,
						@CalculatedFromDate, --FromDate,
						@CalculatedToDate, --ToDate,
						BillRenderDate,
						dbo.CalculateNumberOfBillingDays(@CalculatedFromDate,@CalculatedToDate), --BillingDays,
						@CCFMonthlyLastPeriod, --BilledCCF,
						ThermFactor,
						@ThermsMonthlyLastPeriod, --BilledTherms,
						NumberOfMeters,
						BillType,
						@CommodityChargeAmountMonthlyLastPeriod, --CommodityChargeAmount,
						@DeliveryChargeAmountMonthlyLastPeriod, --DeliveryChargeAmount,
						@MTACommodityTaxMonthlyLastPeriod, --MTACommodityTax,
						@MTADeliveryTaxMonthlyLastPeriod, --MTADeliveryTax,
						@SalesTaxMonthlyLastPeriod, --SalesTax,
						@SystemBenefitsChargeMonthlyLastPeriod, -- SystemBenefitsCharge,
						@RetailDecouplingMechanismChargeMonthlyLastPeriod, --RetailDecouplingMechanismCharge,
						@DeliveryRateSurchargeMonthlyLastPeriod, --DeliveryRateSurcharge,
						@RealTimeNormalizationChargeMonthlyLastPeriod, -- RealTimeNormalizationCharge,
						@LatePaymentChargeMonthlyLastPeriod, --LatePaymentCharge,
						@PaperBillChargeMonthlyLastPeriod, --PaperBillCharge,
						CommodityCostFactor,
						MTACommodityFactor,
						MTADeliveryFactor,
						SalesTaxFactor,SystemBenefitChargeFactor,
						RetailDecouplingMechanismFactor,
						DeliveryRateSurchargeFactor,
						RealTimeNormalizationFactor,
						LatePaymentFactor,
						PriorPeriodAccountBalance,
						AccountArrears,
						TerminationBalance,
						TotalPaymentsPosted,
						CurrentAccountBalance,
						DateLastPayment,
						MiscellaneousChargeAmount,
						MiscellaneousChargeType,
						@GasChargeAmount, --SpannedGasChargeAmount,
						@BilledCCF, --SpannedBilledCCF,
						@BilledTherms, --SpannedBilledTherms,
						@CalculatedBillingPeriodRevision, --[SpannedBillingPeriodRevision]
						@FirstBillingPeriodCanceled, --[SpannedFirstBillingPeriodCanceled]
						@BillingFromDate, --[SpannedFromDate]
						@BillingToDate, --[SpannedToDate]
						getdate(), --LastUpdate,
						@Notes, -- Notes,
						AuthenticatedUserID,
						getdate(), --DateAdded
						TransactionCode,FirstNewCRISBillingPeriodRevision,@GasChargeSummedPieces
		FROM CrisNationalGridWest.UploadCrisAccountBillingCancellation	
		WHERE   (UploadCrisAccountBillingCancellationSeqid = @UploadCrisAccountBillingCancellationSeqid) 
		--
		--print @Notes+'=========>Lsst:  '+ cast(@@rowcount as varchar(10))+'>>>>>>>>>>>>>'+@CalculatedFromDate+'----'+@CalculatedToDate
	--
	--	Process the next row
	--
		FETCH NEXT FROM SpannedGasBillCursor INTO @UploadCrisAccountBillingCancellationSeqid,@NumberOfBillingPeriod,@BillingPeriodRevision

End -- end processing for fetched record

CLOSE SpannedGasBillCursor; -- close cursor
DEALLOCATE SpannedGasBillCursor;
--
print 'Number of spanned rows: '+ cast(@NumberOfSpannedRows as varchar(10))
print 'Number of Parsed transactions: '+ cast(@NumberOfParsedSpannedTranscations as varchar(10))

END
